abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column observes San Francisco Giants and newly signed first baseman Jeff Samardzija both aim to continue team's tradition of winning World Series on even-numbered years.

headline.print_headline: A Team Looking to Bounce Back Turns to a Pitcher With the Same Goal
headline.main: A Team Looking to Bounce Back Turns to a Pitcher With the Same Goal

snippet: The Giants signed Jeff Samardzija for five years and $90 million, and gave a six-year, $130 million contract to another right-hander, Johnny Cueto, hoping to continue their recent tradition of winning World Series in even-numbered years.
lead_paragraph: The Giants signed Jeff Samardzija for five years and $90 million, and gave a six-year, $130 million contract to another right-hander, Johnny Cueto, hoping to continue their recent tradition of winning World Series in even-numbered years.
